instruction: What Is Name Of School?
response: The School Name Is G.D. Goenka Public School, Delhi

instruction: Where is the school located?
response: The school is located at Bhagwan Mahaveer Rd, Pocket 8, Sector B, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi, Delhi 110070.

instruction: How can parents contact the school?
response: Parents may call the Admissions Office at (123) 456-7890, email admissions@school.edu, or submit inquiries via the Contact Us form on our website www.school.edu/contact.

instruction: What is the admission process?
response: To apply, submit an online application form, pay the non-refundable registration fee, and upload scanned copies of: 1) Birth certificate, 2) Previous two years’ report cards, 3) Immunization record, 4) Proof of residence (utility bill or lease), and 5) Two passport-size photographs. Shortlisted candidates attend a grade-appropriate assessment and parent interview. Final offers are communicated via email.
keywords: online application;registration fee;birth certificate;report cards;immunization;proof of residence;photographs;assessment;interview

instruction: When is the application deadline for the next academic year?
response: The deadline to submit complete applications is March 31, 2025. Late applications may be considered subject to seat availability and must include a written request to the Admissions Office.

instruction: Can you give an overview of campus facilities?
response: Our 20-acre campus includes air-conditioned classrooms with smart boards, dedicated labs for Physics, Chemistry, Biology, and Computer Science, a STEM makerspace, library media center, auditorium, art studios, gymnasium, swimming pool, cafeteria, health center, and secure parking.
keywords: smart boards;science labs;makerspace;library media center;auditorium;art studios;gymnasium;swimming pool;health center

instruction: What library facilities are available?
response: The library media center houses over 12,000 books, subscribes to 200+ journals, provides quiet study carrels, group discussion rooms, and digital access to e-books and academic databases (JSTOR, EBSCO). It operates 8 am–6 pm on weekdays.

instruction: What sports facilities does the school offer?
response: We feature an Olympic-sized swimming pool, basketball and volleyball courts, FIFA-approved soccer field, indoor badminton hall, tennis courts, athletics track, fitness center, and professional coaching programs.
keywords: swimming pool;basketball courts;volleyball courts;soccer field;badminton hall;tennis courts;athletics track;fitness center

instruction: What transport services are provided?
response: We operate a fleet of GPS-monitored, air-conditioned buses on 15 city routes. Each bus is staffed by a driver and attendant, follows a published timetable, and includes child-safety features like seat belts and RFID check-in.

instruction: What security measures are in place on campus?
response: Security includes 24/7 trained guards, 200+ CCTV cameras, biometric access cards for all buildings, perimeter fencing, ID badge checks, and quarterly emergency drills in partnership with local fire and police departments.
keywords: CCTV;biometric access;ID badges;fire drills;police drills;perimeter fencing

instruction: Describe the cafeteria and meal services.
response: Our cafeteria offers balanced meals prepared daily under HACCP standards. Options include vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, and halal menus. Nutritional charts are displayed, and parents can view weekly menus online.

instruction: What is the kindergarten curriculum?
response: Kindergarten follows a play-based curriculum focusing on language skills, early numeracy, motor development, sensory exploration, social-emotional learning, music, and visual arts. Weekly themes integrate storytelling, games, and outdoor play.

instruction: What is the curriculum and co-curricular program in Grade 3?
response: Grade 3 includes English Language Arts, Mathematics, General Science, Social Studies, Art, and Physical Education. Co-curricular options: choir, chess club, and introductory coding.

instruction: What is the curriculum and co-curricular program in Grade 4?
response: Grade 4 covers English, Mathematics, Life Science, History, Geography, Art & Craft, and PE. Co-curricular: drama club, school band, and eco-garden project.

instruction: What is the curriculum and co-curricular program in Grade 5?
response: Grade 5 offers English, Mathematics, Physical Science, Life Science, Civics, Geography, Visual Arts, and PE. Co-curricular: debate team, art workshops, and environmental club.

instruction: What is the curriculum and co-curricular program in Grade 6?
response: Grade 6 includes English, Pre-Algebra, General Science, World History, Computer Studies, and PE. Co-curricular: science club, robotics club, and interschool athletics.

instruction: What is the curriculum and co-curricular program in Grade 7?
response: Grade 7 covers English, Algebra I, Life Science, Geography, Civics, Information Technology, and PE. Co-curricular: coding club, music ensemble, and Model UN.

instruction: What is the curriculum and co-curricular program in Grade 8?
response: Grade 8 includes English, Geometry, Physical Science, Ancient History, Economics, Digital Literacy, and PE. Co-curricular: debate club, robotics team, and art society.

instruction: What is the curriculum and co-curricular program in Grade 9?
response: Grade 9 offers English, Algebra II, Biology, World History, Computer Science, Visual Arts, and PE. Co-curricular: science fair, drama club, and student council.
keywords: Algebra II;Biology;World History;Computer Science;Visual Arts;PE;science fair;drama;student council

instruction: What is the curriculum and co-curricular program in Grade 10?
response: Grade 10 includes English Literature, Geometry, Chemistry, Geography, ICT, and PE. Co-curricular: entrepreneurship club, art exhibitions, and interschool sports.

instruction: What is the curriculum and co-curricular program in Grade 11?
response: Grade 11 students select streams: Science (Physics, Chemistry, Biology/Math), Commerce (Accounting, Economics, Business Studies), or Humanities (History, Psychology, Sociology), plus English and PE. Co-curricular: research club and literary magazine.

instruction: What is the curriculum and co-curricular program in Grade 12?
response: Grade 12 extends stream subjects with advanced modules, mandatory project work, and university prep seminars. Co-curricular: senior leadership forum and career counseling workshops.

instruction: What extracurricular clubs are available?
response: We offer over 20 clubs: Robotics, Debate, Drama, Art, Music, Environmental, Coding, Model UN, Entrepreneurship, and Yearbook. Each meets weekly under faculty supervision.

instruction: How is technology integrated in classrooms?
response: Classrooms feature interactive smart boards, student tablets, high-speed Wi-Fi, Google Classroom, coding platforms (Scratch, Python), and VR modules for virtual field trips.

instruction: What special education support is offered?
response: Support includes Individualized Education Plans (IEPs), resource room access, differentiated instruction, and services from certified specialists: speech therapists, occupational therapists, and educational psychologists.

instruction: What health and wellness services are available?
response: We provide an on-site health center staffed by a nurse and physician, annual screenings (vision, hearing, dental), mental health counseling, mindfulness sessions, and a fitness studio with certified trainers.
